page.title: 18FARMING AROUND BUILTH WELLS
page.content: The farmland around Builth is mostly grassland. Sheep are grazed extensively on the higher ground, especially on Mynydd Epynt while quite a few cattle are kept on the richer lower ground,especially in the Wye valley.Hay and silage is made in large quantities in early summer and stored in barns or silage clamps for winter feed.Many of the farms in the Builth district have hill rights for sheep and ponies though most of the hills are covered with bracken. Even this bracken is harvested by some farmers for animal bedding in the autumn. Cattle are kept mainly for beef with some kept on for breeding.Some milk is sold. There is a thriving local market for sheep and cattle in Builth though some farmers send their animals to Brecon,Hay,Talgarth,Rhayadr,etc. Sales are also held on the Royal Welsh.
